alert.note: Alert for Moffat (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 11:23AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Colorado, including Moffat County and the City of Craig. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Several structures are flooded and some sand bagging operations are continuing. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from snowmelt. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1123 AM MDT, emergency management reported flooding in the warned area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... West Prong South Fork Slater Creek, Big Gulch, North Fork Fortification Creek, Taylor Creek, Fortification Creek, Fourmile Creek, Little Cottonwood Creek, Yampa River, Dry Fork Little Bear Creek, Timberlake Creek, Little Bear Creek, Blue Gravel Creek and Falls Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Craig. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
